Replying to 
@Joe_Saz
 and 
@shanenixon11
Premining is a loaded term with artificial boundaries.  The subtext is that someone accumulated in isolation prior to public exposure.  Ripple did this, but so did Satoshi (1 million bitcoins), and pretty much every other coin.  Saying Bitcoin wasn't premined isn't honest

Replying to 
@NoahPierau
 @BreakerMag
 and 4 others
This was in reference to the network and consensus mechanisms. Right now, just 5 mining pools control decisions for Bitcoin. There are diminishing benefits as the number scales, however. I would argue that 41,000 is not meaningfully different than 4,500. But 5 is simply too few.
